alert.note: Alert for Fulton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 18 at 4:45AM EST until February 18 at 1:30PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. Ice jams could form in some locations. * WHERE...A portion of eastern New York, including the following counties, Fulton, Herkimer and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 745 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 445 AM EST, Rainfall and snowmelt is causing rises on small streams. Where river ice is present, it is moving and could cause additional flooding if it stops moving and jams. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Amsterdam, Gloversville, Johnstown, Ilion, Herkimer, Little Falls, Canajoharie, Fonda, Mohawk, Frankfort, Fort Plain, Dolgeville, St. Johnsville, Ephratah, Hagaman, Middleville, Fort Johnson, Ames, Jordanville and Tribes Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
